it.dc.bridge.rd

Class ResourceDirectory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.californium.core.CoapServer
      • it.dc.bridge.rd.ResourceDirectory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, org.eclipse.californium.core.server.ServerInterface

    public class ResourceDirectory
extends org.eclipse.californium.core.CoapServer
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The class ResourceDirectory provides a RD that implements the functions required to register, maintain and remove the CoAP resources. It does not implement resource lookup, as described in draft-ietf-core-resource-directory-05.

    For the management of the resources, ResourceDirectory uses the classes provided by the Californium cf-rd package.

    The ResourceDirectory has been re-implemented because of incompleteness and the interaction with the other Bridge components: when a resource registration or a resource removal occur, the ResourceDirectory has to notify the AJObjectManagerApp and the CoAPProxy.

      • addNode

        public void addNode(java.lang.String nodeID,
                    java.lang.String context)
        Associates the specified context with the specified node in the context map. If the map previously contained a mapping for the node, the old context is replaced by the specified context.
        Parameters:
        nodeID - node identifier
        context - node context

      • getContext

        public java.lang.String getContext(java.lang.String nodeID)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the node context, if present

      • removeNode

        public void removeNode(java.lang.String nodeID)
        Removes the mapping for a node identifier from this map if it is present. Informs the resource map about the node removal.
        Parameters:
        nodeID - the node identifier

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(RDNodeResource node,
                     org.eclipse.californium.core.CoapResource resource)
        Associates the specified resource with the specified node in the resource map. Adds the node context if not present or updates it if was changed. Then, the methods informs the AJObjectManagerApp about the arrival of a new resource.
        Parameters:
        node - the node resources
        resource - the new registered resource

      • removeEntries

        public void removeEntries(java.lang.String nodeID)
        Removes the mapping for the resources with a specific associated node. For each removed resource, the method informs the AJObjectManagerApp about the resource removal.
        Parameters:
        nodeID - the node identifier

      • getResourcePath

        public java.lang.String getResourcePath(java.lang.String path)
        Returns the resource path within its parent node starting from the resource path within the ResourceDirectory.
        Parameters:
        path - the resource uri
        Returns:
        the resource path

      • printMaps

        Prints all the entries for both the context map and the resource map.
